plants.fact: "Lettuce, potato, tomato, other legumes, crucifers, or cucurbits increase sclerotinia" in the soil and should be avoided before and after snap beans. See the entry for "Legumes" for more info

plants.helpers: corn, radish
plants.fact: the stalk of the corn provides a pole for the beans to grow on, which then gives nitrogen to the soil of the corn.circular reference As for the Radishes, see the entry for "Legumes" for more info

plants.fact: See the entry for "Legumes" for more info

plants.helps: Broccoli, bush beans, cabbage, lettuce, kohlrabi, onions, brassicas, passion fruit
plants.helpers: bush beans, onions, kohlrabi, catnip, garlic, lettuce, brassicas, mint
plants.fact: Good for adding minerals to the soil through composting leaves which have up to 25% magnesium. Runner or pole beans and beets stunt each other's growth.

plants.helpers: Beets, spinach, chard,celery, chamomile, marigolds, Dill, sage, peas, peppermint, spearmint, spurrey, rosemary, rye-grass, garlic, geraniums, alliums, nasturtium, borage, hyssop, tansy,tomatoes,thyme, wormwood, southernwood, beans, clover

plants.fact: Brassicas are a family of plants which includes broccoli, Brussels sprouts, cabbage, cauliflower, Chinese cabbage, kohlrabi, radish, and turnip. Thyme, nasturtiums, and onion showed good resistance to cabbage worm, weevil and cabbage looper

plants.helpers: bak choi,  Beets, dill, lettuce, mustard, onions, tomato, turnip, clover
plants.fact: Broccoli as a main crop intercropped with lettuce was shown to be more profitable than either crop alone. Turnip acts as a trap crop. See brassicas entry for more info

plants.helpers: Sage, thyme, clover, malting barley
Beans, clover, marigold, chamomile, larkspur, nasturtiums, dill, coriander, hyssop, onions, beets, marigolds, mint, rosemary, sage, thyme, tomatoes, lacy phacelia
plants.fact: See brassicas entry for more info. If using clover as an intercrop it should be sown after cabbage transplant so as not to affect crop yield. Nasturtiums repel cabbage moths

plants.helps: Tomatoes, alliums, beans, leeks, lettuce, onions, passion fruit
plants.helpers: lettuce, alliums, rosemary, wormwood, sage, beans, flax
plants.attracts: Assassin bug, lacewing, parasitic wasp, yellow jacket and other predatory wasps
plants.fact: Tomatoes grow better with carrots, but may stunt the carrots' growth. Beans provide the nitrogen carrots need more than some other vegetables. Aromatic companion plants repel carrot fly. Sage, rosemary, and radishes are recommended by some as companion plants, but listed by others as incompatible. Alliums inter-planted with carrots confuse onion and carrot flies. For the beneficial insect-attracting properties of carrots to work, they need to be allowed to flower; Otherwise, use the wild carrot, Queen Anne's Lace, for the same effect. Flax produces an oil that may protect root vegetables like carrots from some pests.

plants.helpers: Mixture of Chinese cabbage, marigolds,sunflower, Spinach,peas
plants.fact: One row of spinach alternating at 60Â cm from each row of cauliflower proved mutually beneficial.citation needed See brassicas for more info. See peas regarding their mutualism with cauliflower.

plants.helpers: Cosmos, daisies, snapdragons, leeks, tomatoes, cauliflower, cabbage, bush beans
plants.fact: Aster flowers, can transmit the aster yellows disease.

plants.helpers: Sunflowers, dill, beans, peas, soybeans, peanuts, cucurbits, clover, amaranth, white geranium, pigweed, lamb's quarters, morning glory, parsley, and potato, field mustard
plants.fact: Provides beans with a trellis, is protected from predators and dryness by cucurbits, in the three sisters technique

plants.helpers: kohlrabi, nasturtiums, radishes, marigolds, sunflowers, peas, beans, chamomile, beets, carrots, dill, onions, garlic, celery, spinach
plants.fact: Sow 2 or 3 radish seeds in with cucumbers to repel cucumber beetles. One study showed a 75% reduction in cucumber beetles with the concurrent seeding of amaranth. Various sprays from lettuce, asparagus, Malabar spinach, and celery were found to reduce whiteflies.See cucurbits entry for more info

plants.helpers: corn, grain sorghum, beans
plants.fact: Cucurbits are a family of plants that includes melons, cucumbers, gourds, pumpkins, and squash.

plants.fact: Hosts nitrogen-fixing bacteria, a good fertiliser for some plants, too much for others. Rosemary and peppermint extracts are used in organic sprays for beans. Summer savory and potatoes repel bean beetles.

plants.fact: Mints (including hyssop, sage, and various "balms") repel slugs, a pest of lettuce and cabbages. Broccoli when inter-cropped with lettuce was shown to be more profitable then either crop alone.

garlic,onion, radish
plants.fact: The flowers of the parsnip plant left to seed will attract a variety of predatory insects to the garden, they are particularly helpful when left under fruit trees, the predators attacking codling moth and light brown apple moth. The root also contains Myristricin, which is toxic to fruit flies, house flies, red spider mite, pea aphids, a simple blender made extraction of three blended parsnips roots to one litre of water through a food processor (not one for preparing food) and left overnight, strained and use within a few days.

plants.helpers: turnip, cauliflower, garlic, mints
plants.fact: Peas when intercropped with turnips, cauliflower, or garlic showed mutual suppression of growth however their profit per land area used was increased.

plants.helpers: beans, tomatoes, marjoram,okra, geraniums, petunias, sunflowers, onions crimson clover, basil, field mustard
plants.fact: Pepper plants like high humidity, which can be helped along by planting with some kind of dense-leaf or ground-cover companion, like marjoram and basil; they also need direct sunlight, but their fruit can be harmed by it...pepper plants grown together, or with tomatoes, can shelter the fruit from sunlight, and raises the humidity level. Sunflowers, when in bloom at the right time, sheltered beneficial insects which lowered thrips populations.

plants.helps: Brassicas, beans, corn, peas, passion fruit
plants.helpers: horseradish, beans, dead nettle, marigolds, peas, onion, garlic, thyme, clover
plants.avoid: Atriplex, carrot, cucumber, pumpkin, raspberries, squash, sunflower, tomato
plants.fact: Horseradish increases the disease resistance of potatoes. It repels the potato bug. Garlic was shown to be more effective than fungicides on late potato blight.65 Peas were shown to reduce the density of Colorado potato beetles.

plants.helpers: buckwheat, Jimson weed, catnip, oregano, tansy, radishes, nasturtiums
plants.fact: Radishes can be used as a trap crop against flea beetles, cucurbita can be used in the three sisters technique. Nasturtiums repel squash bugs.

plants.helps: Squash, eggplant, cucumber, lettuce, peas, beans, pole beans,
plants.helpers: chervil, lettuce, nasturtiums
plants.fact: Radishes can be used as a trap crop against flea beetles. Radishes grown with lettuce taste better.

plants.helpers: corn, snap beans, sunflower
plants.fact: A mixture of corn, mungbean, and sunflower was found to rid soybeans of aphids. Snap beans act as a trap crop for Mexican bean beetles in soybeans.citation needed

plants.helpers: strawberries, peas, beans, cauliflowercitation needed
plants.fact: The peas and beans provide natural shade for the spinach. See cauliflower notes regarding mutualism with spinach.citation needed

plants.helpers: beans, buckwheat, borage, catnip, tansy, radishes, marigolds, nasturtiums
plants.fact: Radishes can be used as a trap crop against flea beetles, cucurbita can be used in the three sisters technique. Marigolds and nasturtiums repel squash bugs. Marigolds repel cucumber beetles.

plants.fact: Okra and sweet potato are mutually beneficial when planted simultaneously.

plants.helpers: asparagus, basil, beans, bee balm, oregano, parsley, marigold, alliums, garlic, leeks, celery, geraniums, petunias, nasturtium, borage, coriander, chives, corn, dill, mustard, fenugreek, barley, carrots, eggplant, mints, okra, sage, thyme
plants.avoid: Black walnut, alfalfa, corn, fennel, chili peppers, peas, dill, potatoes, beetroot, brassicas, rosemary
plants.fact: Black walnuts inhibit tomato growth, in fact they are negative allelopathic  to all other nightshade plants (chili pepper, potato, tobacco, petunia) as well, because it produces a chemical called juglone. Dill attracts tomato hornworm.Growing tomatoes with Basil does not appear to enhance tomato flavour but studies have shown that growing them around 10 inches apart can increase the yield of tomatoes by about 20%. One study shows that growing chili peppers near tomatoes in greenhouses increases tomato whitefly on the tomatoes.

plants.helpers: peas
plants.fact: Turnips act as a trap crop for broccoli. See peas regarding their mutualism with turnips.
